title: How to Read Care Labels
subtitle: A quick guide to understanding garment care symbols
body_md:
# How to Read Care Labels

Understanding care labels is essential for keeping your clothes looking their best. Here's what you need to know:

## Basic Symbols

- **Washing**: Look for the tub symbol with numbers indicating temperature
- **Bleaching**: Triangle symbols indicate if bleaching is safe
- **Drying**: Square with circle shows tumble dry settings
- **Ironing**: Iron symbol with dots for temperature
- **Dry Cleaning**: Circle symbols for professional cleaning

## Temperature Guidelines

- 30°C (86°F): Delicate fabrics
- 40°C (104°F): Normal cotton and synthetic fabrics
- 60°C (140°F): Heavily soiled items
- 95°C (203°F): White cotton and linen

## Pro Tips

- Always check labels before washing
- When in doubt, use cooler temperatures
- Separate items by care requirements

title: Sorting Laundry Like a Pro
subtitle: Master the art of laundry sorting for better results
body_md:
# Sorting Laundry Like a Pro

Proper sorting is the foundation of effective laundry care.

## Sort by Color

- **Whites**: Sheets, towels, white clothing
- **Lights**: Pastels and light colors
- **Darks**: Black, navy, dark colors
- **Reds**: Separate reds to prevent bleeding

## Sort by Fabric Type

- **Delicates**: Silk, lace, lingerie
- **Heavy Items**: Jeans, towels, bedding
- **Light Items**: T-shirts, underwear

## Sort by Soil Level

- **Heavily Soiled**: Work clothes, sports gear
- **Lightly Soiled**: Office wear, casual clothes

title: Hypoallergenic Washing
subtitle: Gentle care for sensitive skin
body_md:
# Hypoallergenic Washing

Special care for sensitive skin and allergies.

## Choose the Right Detergent

- Look for fragrance-free options
- Avoid optical brighteners
- Use gentle, pH-neutral formulas
- Consider natural alternatives

## Washing Tips

- Use extra rinse cycles
- Wash new clothes before wearing
- Avoid fabric softeners
- Use hot water for bedding

## Drying Considerations

- Air dry when possible
- Use fragrance-free dryer sheets
- Clean dryer regularly

title: Saving Water and Energy
subtitle: Eco-friendly laundry practices
body_md:
# Saving Water and Energy

Make your laundry routine more sustainable.

## Water Conservation

- Wash full loads only
- Use cold water when possible
- Choose high-efficiency machines
- Reuse water for plants

## Energy Efficiency

- Air dry when possible
- Use dryer balls
- Clean lint filters
- Choose energy-efficient settings

## Detergent Tips

- Use concentrated formulas
- Measure correctly
- Choose eco-friendly brands
- Make your own when possible

title: Stain Pre-treatment Guide
subtitle: Act fast for best stain removal results
body_md:
# Stain Pre-treatment Guide

Quick action is key to successful stain removal.

## General Rules

- Act immediately
- Blot, don't rub
- Test treatments on hidden areas
- Work from outside to inside

## Common Pre-treatments

- **Enzymatic cleaners**: For protein stains
- **Oxygen bleach**: For organic stains
- **Solvent cleaners**: For oil-based stains
- **Baking soda paste**: For general use

## Timing is Everything

- **Fresh stains**: Treat immediately
- **Dried stains**: Soak first
- **Set stains**: May need professional help
